meanings.definition: The pointed or rounded end of something
meanings.sent1: The pencil had a sharp tip for writing.
meanings.sent2: The tip of the iceberg was visible above the water.
meanings.sent3: Careful not to poke yourself with the sharp tip of the needle!
meanings.sent4: The tip of the mountain was covered in snow.
meanings.sent5: The tip of the arrow gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A small piece of advice or helpful hint
meanings.sent1: She gave me a great tip on how to improve my cooking.
meanings.sent2: His tip about time management really helped me.
meanings.sent3: Thanks for the tip on where to find the best pizza in town!
meanings.sent4: The tip to relax and take deep breaths before the exam was useful.
meanings.sent5: The tip to always double-check your work saved me from mistakes.

meanings.definition: To give a small amount of money to someone for their service
meanings.sent1: I always tip the waiter for good service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to tip the delivery person for bringing your package.
meanings.sent3: He decided to tip the barista for the delicious coffee.
meanings.sent4: She likes to tip generously when she receives excellent service.
meanings.sent5: It is customary to tip the valet when they park your car.

meanings.sent1: Be careful not to tip the vase while moving it.
meanings.sent2: The boat started to tip slightly in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The gust of wind almost caused the umbrella to tip over.
meanings.sent4: The heavy box began to tip as he lifted it off the ground.
meanings.sent5: The treehouse seemed to tip to one side after the storm.

meanings.sent1: She used her finger to tip the edge of the book.
meanings.sent2: The butterfly would tip the flowers gently with its wings.
meanings.sent3: He would tip the keys of the piano softly to create a melody.
meanings.sent4: The cat would tip the glass off the table with a playful paw.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops would tip the leaves of the trees as they fell.
